Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida

It was a full satisfaction for me to receive the most esteemed letter of Your Excellency dated June 21st just past, and, by virtue of what it requires, I hereby enclose a copy of the answers given by the Government of the Rio-Grandense Republic and by its Generals David Canabarro and João Antônio da Silveira on the occasion of the invitation made by the Baron of Caxias for the proposition of the bases on which the cessation of the war then sustained against the Empire was to be established. As for the peoples of Japeju and São Tomé, my father-in-law says they belong to the Missions to the west of Uruguay, and are situated on the right bank of this river. I shall appreciate that in this manner the requirement of Your Excellency is satisfied.

Your Excellency

Your Excellency

Your Excellency

My son Antônio Pedroso de Albuquerque is the bearer of this letter; he is going to São Paulo to complete his graduation in Law, and since it is difficult to meet with Your Excellency,

Your Excellency

José Pedroso de Albuquerque.

Alegrete, September 16, 1860

From Mr. José Pedroso de Albuquerque.

Received on September 26, 1860.

Answered on September 26, 1860.
